1.text: Evening. Smells good tonight. You always keep the fryer running this late?

options.text: 1. Yeah, it’s part of the job.

2.text: Part of the job... right. Work never really ends, does it? Not for people like you.

3.text: Oh, a few times. I come by when the night’s quiet—when the lights are the only things still alive out here.

options.text: 1. That’s a strange way to put it.
2. You’re not from around here, are you?

4.text: Hmm. Maybe I just notice things. The hum of your machines, the pulse under your skin. Everything in this place feels... warm.

5.text: Tired? No, not tired. Just hungry. It’s been a long night.

6.text: You wouldn’t understand. It’s not the food I come for. It’s the sound. The sizzling. The smell when something starts to burn.

7.text: Home... that’s a funny word. I think I had one once. A kitchen. A table. People to eat with.

8.text: They stopped eating. So I found others. You can’t waste good meat, right?

9.text: Don’t worry. I already ordered. You just keep cooking. I’ll handle the rest.
